answers.question: Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?

answers.answer:
üåø 2025 Goals, Objectives & Milestones

üéØ Goal 1: Strengthen Bioregional Governance Through Relationship Building & Education
Objective: Build trust, shared language, and readiness within the Bioregional Organizing Team (BOT) and advisory ecosystem.

Q1 Milestone: Continue weekly BOT meetings; initiate relational outreach to Indigenous and elder advisors

Q2 Milestone: Host cross-cultural governance learning sessions and develop onboarding pathways for advisors

Q3 Milestone: Establish a shared governance vocabulary and develop draft sociocratic/consensus-based protocols

Q4 Milestone: Document collective agreements and map BOT capacity gaps for 2026 planning

üéØ Goal 2: Initiate Development of the Bioregional Regeneration Strategy (BRS)
Objective: Begin co-creating a living, long-term vision and action framework informed by regional voices and advisory leadership.

Q1 Milestone: Gather inputs from mapping sessions and regional gatherings into a living ‚ÄúBRS seed document‚Äù

Q2 Milestone: Host first multi-stakeholder strategy sessions, including Indigenous advisory voices (as funded)

Q3 Milestone: Integrate BioFi and global learnings into the evolving strategy document

Q4 Milestone: Publish and circulate a working version of the BRS with defined next steps and feedback loops

üéØ Goal 3: Operationalize the Bioregional Financing Facility (BFF) Prototype
Objective: Build transparent, decentralized infrastructure to support ongoing project funding.

Q1 Milestone: Complete integration with Karma GAP for accountability and visibility

Q2 Milestone: Launch community participatory budgeting pilot and publish first funding report

Q3 Milestone: Iterate BFF systems based on feedback; explore pooled treasury options or pilot impact tokens

Q4 Milestone: Prepare funding readiness assessment for 2026 scaling of BFF architecture

üéØ Goal 4: Expand Regenerative Fundraising & Digital Steward Onboarding
Objective: Grow decentralized funding streams and equip local stewards with Web3 tools.

Q1 Milestone: Participate in Gitcoin GG23, host local funding circle discussions

Q2 Milestone: Onboard 5+ stewards to Giveth, Gitcoin Passport, and Wallet tools

Q3 Milestone: Participate in GG24 and GG25 with project-specific campaigns

Q4 Milestone: Assess fundraising performance and co-design 2026 ReFi education track

üéØ Goal 5: Deepen Bioregional Cohesion and Cultural Identity
Objective: Strengthen place-based belonging and shared vision across the Diamante-Baru bioregion.

Q1 Milestone: Circulate vision language, storytelling toolkit, and visual branding

Q2 Milestone: Coordinate region-wide community listening campaign

Q3 Milestone: Co-host seasonal gathering to share BRS progress and build collective celebration

Q4 Milestone: Capture narratives of impact and regeneration for 2025 wrap-up report
answers.question: What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?

project.title: Diamante Bar√∫ Bioregional Consortium (Costa Rica)
project.description:
üåø‚ÄØ The Diamante Bar√∫ Bioregional Consortium (DBBC)

Is a decentralized initiative regenerating one of Costa Rica‚Äôs most ecologically and culturally vital territories. Grounded in bioregionalism, we coordinate across communities, watersheds, and ecosystems to protect biodiversity, honor Indigenous leadership, and build regenerative economies rooted in care.

As a Commons Consortium, we bring together Indigenous elders, land stewards, regenerative practitioners, and global allies to co-create transparent systems for decision-making, funding, and long-term stewardship. 

Our work lays the foundation for a Bioregional Financing Facility (BFF) that redistributes resources into grassroots regenerative projects through participatory processes.

üåÄ‚ÄØThe Problem

 In the Diamante-Bar√∫ bioregion, powerful regenerative efforts are underway‚Äîbut they remain under-resourced, siloed, and vulnerable to extractive pressures. Without shared infrastructure, decentralized governance, and regenerative financial tools, these initiatives struggle to align, scale, or sustain their impact.
üå±‚ÄØThe Solution

 DBBC is designing and activating decentralized systems for community-led regeneration. We are:

 ‚Ä¢ Mapping bioregional assets and needs
 ‚Ä¢ Prototyping participatory governance and budgeting models
 ‚Ä¢ Hosting Web3-aligned fundraising via Giveth and Gitcoin
 ‚Ä¢ Building the foundation of a Bioregional Financing Facility (BFF)

üíö‚ÄØWhy Your Support Matters

 Support from this round will fund Indigenous advisor stipends, digital infrastructure for decentralized budgeting, and the next phase of bioregional strategy co-creation. Your contribution helps us grow a living ecosystem of trust, equity, and regeneration‚Äîfrom the roots up.
